message: I get out of bed and leave my room.
Maybe I just need some fresh air.
Careful not to make too much noise, I go downstairs, put on my shoes, and head outside.
Just as I'm about to step out onto the street, I notice someone leaning against the wall of the house.
With a flapping of wings, a large bird alights on the man's shoulder.
A cockatoo. It's Mink, a trail of white smoke floating above his head.
To be honest, he's probably the last person I want to see right now.
I turn around to head back inside, but something stops me.
This is Mink, after all. He must have already noticed me.
He'll probably think I'm acting weird if I go right back inside, like I'm trying to avoid him or something.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...What are you doing out here?"

name: ミンク
message: "Nothing."
No conversation emerges, not that this comes as a surprise.
I'm already regretting trying to talk to him.
I think about heading back inside... but something is stopping me. What?
Is there anything I can say?
I mean, he's not the kind of person who'll engage with me on just anything.
I'm not sure my introduction to him could have been more unpleasant, either...
The tension is getting to me. My thoughts have begun to wander on tangents.
Still... it's thanks to Mink that we managed to save Granny.
He kept his end of the bargain.
I guess that I owe him a thank you.
Whatever he's done, it doesn't change the fact that he helped.
He doesn't even look at me when I speak.
...Whatever. I expected as much.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Um... thanks for helping save Granny. I don't think we could've done it without you. It definitely would've taken longer to track her down."
Mink gives me a sidelong glance.

name: ミンク
message: "I didn't do it out of the kindness of my heart. Don't forget that. You better keep up your end of the bargain."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I haven't forgotten anything, alright? I know what you're after... It's the power of my voice, isn't it?"
Mink shifts his gaze toward the sky and brings the pipe to his lips.
I lean up against the wall, keeping a little distance between us.

name: 蒼葉
message: "You were right about my voice. About the effect it has on people."

name: ミンク
message: "So, you didn't believe me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "It's not that... It's just, like, it's weird. Even after what Granny said, it's still hard to believe. But you already knew about it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Wait, how'd you even know?"
Mink looks up again, his eyes staring off into the distance.

name: ミンク
message: "...It's the way your vocal cords vibrate. It's different from everyone else."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Vocal cords?"

name: ミンク
message: "You probably don't remember, but I've heard your voice before. That's when I noticed it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Huh? When?"
There's no way I'd forget a giant like him. When could he have heard my voice?

name: ミンク
message: "That's when I started looking for you. I needed to be sure of what your voice was."

name: 蒼葉
message: "So that's why you were after me..."

name: ミンク
message: "Power alone is meaningless. But I think you already know that, don't you?"
Well... I guess he's right. There's no point having this power unless I know how to use it.
Worse, it's like walking through a minefield. If I can't control it, there's a good chance I might hurt someone else.

name: ミンク
message: "I'm not just talking about your power. Any weapon―any tool―is worthless if left unused. The rest depends on how you use it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "But I never asked for this power. I don't want to use it."

name: ミンク
message: "Then don't. That's up to you. However..."
Suddenly, Mink is standing in front of me, boxing me in with his arms.
His cockatoo spreads its wings.

name: ミンク
message: "First, you're going to use it to help me get what I want. You don't have a choice."
His stare is so cold, it turns the air to ice.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...And what do you want?"

name: ミンク
message: "You don't need to know that yet."
Mink pulls away from me, then starts walking off down the street.
Before long, his massive figure has vanished into the night.
As I watch him leave, I wonder what I should do.
It's clear that Mink ultimately sees me as nothing but a means to an end.
He's not my friend, and he's not trying to help.
All he wants is my power.
Still, Mink held up his end of the bargain. I want to hold up mine.
I really do... but at the same time...

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I give up."
I'm thinking in circles. Time to head back inside.
Once back in bed, I don't really feel like sleeping, so I just stare at the ceiling for a while.
